void GrImage::CompressDXT1 ( bool  normalMap  ) 

this is used for DXT5 normal map compression!

expand the image to BGRA if necessary.

make sure the image is in the appropriate format.

Make sure mipmaps are available since we're compressing the existing data.

compress to DXT1.

calculate the width and height of the current mipmap.

allocate space for the current mip-level.

get the current mip level and calculate it's stride.

compress the miplevel.

free the previous mip-level and replace it with the compressed data.

change info about the image.

sends the images (all mip-levels) to the currently bound OpenGL texture in compressed form. Note that the texture must be in a compressed format for this to work.

make sure glTexFormat is a supported compression format and that the format of the image is EF_BGRA32.

void GrImage::ConvertToI8 ( bool  keepMipMaps = true  ) 

converts a luminance image to alpha. This is a no-op if the image is not EF_L8. The opposite is true for AlphaToLum.

check for early outs.

store whether or not we had mipmaps to begin with and then clear mipmaps.

create the new pointer for the data bits.

store alpha.

use blue component.

invalid source format. Must be 8-bit.

store the format change.

free up the old memory and store the new memory.

rebuild mipmaps if necessary.

Definition at line 215 of file GrImage.cpp.

void GrImage::LumToAlpha (  ) 

void GrImage::SwizzleToBXRG (  ) 

This function replicates R to channels RGB, and move G to the A channel. If the image is RGB, it will be converted to RGBA first. If the image is L8 or LA16/64F, then this function will simply return.

floating point images are not supported at this time.

do we need to expand the image from RGB to RGBA?

only format that should be possible right here is RGBA32.

go through each level and swizzle.

zyxa -> zaxy alpha = green.

unpack X, Y, and Z.

divide X and Y by Z.

repack the values.
